instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly outward.
Engage your core and keep chest up.
Push hips back as if sitting on a chair.
Lower down until thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below.
Keep weight on your heels and midfoot.
Push through your heels to return to standing.
Maintain a neutral spine and avoid rounding your back.
Keep shoulders relaxed and away from ears.
Look straight ahead to maintain head alignment.
Engage glutes and hamstrings on ascent.
Control the descent; avoid bouncing.
Keep knees tracking over toes, not inward.
Breathe in on the way down and out on the way up.
Distribute weight evenly across both legs.
Adjust feet if necessary for balance and comfort.
corrections: Push knees outward to align with toes and maintain stability.
Keep chest up and spine neutral to prevent forward lean.
Keep heels grounded, engage calves and glutes for stability.
Lower until thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
Maintain neutral spine; avoid rounding back.
Focus gaze forward or slightly up to help posture.
Adjust feet to shoulder-width for proper alignment.
Adjust feet to shoulder-width; avoid excessive width.
Keep knees behind toes by hinging hips back.
Breathe in on descent and out when rising.
Distribute weight evenly on both legs.
Descend smoothly without bouncing; maintain control.
Engage glutes and hamstrings throughout the movement.
Slightly bend knees at the top instead of locking.
Maintain even weight on both sides.
Point toes slightly outward for natural alignment.
Keep lower back neutral; avoid arching.
Keep heels planted until fully standing.
Rotate torso to stay aligned with hips.

instructions: Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders.
Keep body in a straight line from head to heels.
Engage core and glutes.
Lower body until chest nearly touches the floor.
Keep elbows at a 45-degree angle from the body.
Push through palms to return to starting position.
Maintain neutral neck position, looking slightly ahead.
Breathe in on the way down and out on the way up.
Keep shoulders and hips level.
Avoid sagging hips or raising buttocks too high.
common_mistakes: Looking straight down or up excessively
corrections: Engage core to keep hips in line.
Maintain straight body alignment from head to heels.
Position hands under shoulders for proper load.
Lower chest until just above the floor.
Look slightly ahead to keep neck neutral.
Avoid twisting torso; keep hips square.
Slightly bend elbows at top to avoid locking.
Keep feet together or hip-width apart for stability.
Do not strain neck; maintain alignment.

instructions: Start on forearms and toes, elbows under shoulders.
Maintain a straight line from head to heels.
Engage core, glutes, and quads.
Keep shoulders down and away from ears.
Hold the position for the desired duration.
Breathe steadily throughout.
Avoid letting hips sag or pike upwards.
Keep neck neutral, looking at the floor.
Distribute weight evenly on forearms and toes.
Adjust elbow position if uncomfortable.
corrections: Engage core and glutes to keep body straight.
Lower hips to align with shoulders and heels.
Maintain neutral spine; avoid arching back.
Relax shoulders and keep them down.
Keep neck neutral, eyes on floor.
Evenly distribute weight on forearms and toes.

instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Step forward with one leg, keeping torso upright.
Lower hips until both knees are bent at about 90 degrees.
Front knee should align over ankle.
Back knee should hover just above the ground.
Push through the front heel to return to standing.
Engage core and glutes.
Keep chest up and shoulders back.
Breathe in on descent, out on ascent.
Alternate legs or complete sets on one side.
corrections: Push knees outward, align with toes.
Keep front knee behind toes by stepping far enough.
Lower back knee just above floor, not resting.
Lower fully to reach proper depth.
Slightly bend knees at top instead of locking.

instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
Engage core and keep back straight.
Press dumbbells overhead until arms are fully extended.
Do not lock elbows at top.
Lower weights slowly back to shoulders.
Keep wrists neutral.
Maintain smooth and controlled movements.
Breathe out while pressing, inhale while lowering.
Keep shoulders down and away from ears.
corrections: Engage core to avoid back arching.
Keep elbows close to body path.
Lower weights fully to shoulder height.
Do not lock elbows; maintain slight bend.
Keep wrists straight and aligned with forearms.
Do not lift shoulders; keep them down.

instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells in hands.
Keep elbows close to torso.
Curl weights up towards shoulders.
Keep upper arms stationary.
Squeeze biceps at top of movement.
Lower weights slowly to starting position.
Breathe out when curling up, inhale when lowering.
Avoid swinging weights or using momentum.
Engage core for stability.
Maintain straight back and neutral shoulders.
corrections: Keep elbows stationary by your sides.
Focus on biceps contraction, avoid shoulders.
Maintain even movement for both arms.
Focus on controlled lift and descent.

instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent.
Grip the bat comfortably with top hand providing control and bottom hand providing power.
Keep eyes level and focus on the bowler's release.
Align shoulders and hips towards the bowler.
Position bat close to back foot in ready stance.
Shift weight smoothly from back foot to front foot during shot.
Rotate hips and shoulders to generate power.
Keep head still and eyes on the ball throughout shot.
Follow through fully after striking the ball.
Maintain balanced posture after completing the shot.
Breathe steadily and stay relaxed.
Use wrists for precision shots along the ground.
Adjust stance according to ball length and type.
Keep elbows slightly bent to allow flexibility in shot execution.
Watch the ball onto the bat for proper timing.
Recover quickly to prepare for next shot or run.

corrections: Hold bat until contact and follow through.
Step forward with front foot towards ball.
Transfer weight smoothly from back to front.
Keep head still and eyes on ball.

Maintain consistent line and length.
Use wrist and fingers to swing or spin the ball.

Recover quickly after release for next delivery.

instructions: Stand or sit upright with back straight.
Relax shoulders and arms at your sides.
Lift shoulders slowly towards ears.
Rotate shoulders backward in a circular motion.
Make full, controlled circles with shoulders.
Lower shoulders back to starting position.
Repeat 10–15 times clockwise.
Then rotate shoulders 10–15 times counterclockwise.
Breathe deeply and rhythmically throughout the exercise.
Keep neck relaxed and avoid tilting head forward.
Engage core slightly to maintain balance.
Move slowly to avoid jerking motions.
Focus on smooth, continuous movement.
Do not overstretch shoulder joints.

instructions: Sit or lie down with legs extended comfortably.
Keep knees straight but not locked.
Point toes away from body (plantar flexion).
Pull toes back toward body (dorsiflexion).
Alternate between pointing and flexing 15–20 times.
Breathe normally and stay relaxed.

corrections: Pause at ends of motion for control.
Avoid using momentum; focus on muscle activation.

instructions: Sit or stand with arm supported on a table or bench.

Slowly bend wrist upward (extension).
